section.title: What can you expect from Xaraya and this Guide?
section.para: Xaraya is a flexible package that provides the requisite framework to create content management solutions and web applications for small, medium and large scale installations alike. Xaraya is currently used to develop blogs, community portals, content management solution (CMS) for SMEs, corporate intranet and multisite web solutions, and specialist industry solutions such as applications in e-commerce, finance, education, scientific, or medical areas.

One of the inherent problems that often accompanies the flexibility demonstrated by Xaraya, is a perception of complexity. This Developer Guide aims to reduce that perception of complexity. The Guide does this by illustrating how easily it can be to understand the components that make up Xaraya, and how they can be programatically combined to deliver the functionality you need to create your web application.
This Developer Guide provides the reader with:

listitem.para: information to help understand how Xaraya components work together to deliver web functionality
step by step instructions on how to develop Xaraya extensions such as Modules, Blocks and Hooks
the official and up to date guide ensuring your applications retain compatibility with future Xaraya versions, and can be easily maintained and upgraded

section.title: What do you need to know?
section.para: To best use this Xaraya Developer Guide some assumptions in background knowledge are made. In particular this Guide is not a training manual on PHP, XHTML or popular databases such as MySQL , postgreSQL and SQLite and assumes some familiarity with them at least.
In order to develop with Xaraya, you will need to have an appreciation of the following general Xaraya concepts:

listitem.para: Overview of how Xaraya core functionality works and delivers pages to your web site
Identify key Xaraya components such as modules, blocks, and hooks; their structure; and how they work together to provide functionality in your web application
How you can use Xaraya's templating system, Blocklayout, to manipulate data from Xaraya function output and use it to deliver content to users

section.para: The following chapter in this Guide begins this exploratory journey.
The second part of this Guide, Extending Xaraya using modules, provides a detailed and practical look at how you can start working with Xaraya.
